Answer: <<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter("output.txt", "UTF-8");
for(int i=0;i<10;i++){
    String ans = //get the answer logic here;
    writer.println("Result "+ i +" : "+ ans);
}
writer.close();
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter class in Java is used to print formatted representations of objects to a text-output stream. It is part of java.io package. The PrintWriter class can be used to write formatted data to different targets like the screen, a file, or another output stream. The PrintWriter class provides print(), println(), printf() methods to print various types of data. The println() method is used to print a newline character. The print() method does not print a newline character. The printf() method is used to print the formatted string. The PrintWriter class is a subclass of the OutputStreamWriter class. It provides println(), printf() and print() methods. The PrintWriter class is used to write text to a character-output stream. It can be used to write data to a file, an array, a string buffer, etc.

Please replace the comment `//get the answer logic here;` with your own logic to get the answer.

Note: Always remember to close the PrintWriter after you're done with it to free up system resources.
